newsitem.title: USA: Texas/w Okla feedlot cattle slow at $68 - USDA.
newsitem.headline: Texas/w Okla feedlot cattle slow at $68 - USDA.

text.p: Trade was slow in the Panhandle area Wednesday, USDA said. Slaughter steers and heifers steady.

Feedlots reporting light inquiry from buyers. Sales reported on 4,000 slaughter steers and 2,000 heifers; 155,000 head confirmed for week to date which includes 20,900 formulated cattle and 1,300 previously contracted cattle to be shipped this week and 44 loads or 1,500 CME cattle. Note: all cattle prices based on net weights FOB the feedlot after a 4 percent shrink.
Slaughter Steers: Select and Choice 2-3 1150-1250 lbs 68.00.
Slaughter Heifers: Select and Choice 2-3 1050-1150 lbs 68.00.
Wk to Date: 155,000 Week Ago: 51,600 Year Ago: 48,300
